review: We've used our PS3 to stream everything. However upon recently trying to get HBO Go to work we discovered our cable provider (Starts with C for crud) blocks the PS3 from streaming. Luckily my husband is an IT guy and quickly found a wonderful solution to the absurdity our cable provider created. We have no issue streaming HBO Go with chromcast. In fact we love how easily you can switch between youtube and netflix that we only flip back over to the PS3 for Amazon prime. Super happy we got this!
author: Diana

review: I'll start by saying that I'm not using this unit as intended. I have a Fire TV which is, hands down, best in this class of devices. However, the Fire TV is just a little too big to take with me on trips. I use a Plex server for my movies and TV shows. I have Plex clients on all my mobile devices and sync various videos before a trip. Sometimes it's nice to see a video on a big screen, even if your tablet is technically better. So I plug this into the HDMI of a hotel TV, connect the USB power, seemingly also always present on flatscreens, and screencast my synced Plex material right to the screen with full quality audio/video. There is no compression involved unless you chose to transcode during Plex sync to save space, but that happens before the casting.
